page.title: 06MOSS VALLEY, THE RIVER
page.content: The River Moss is still unpolluted, until it reaches the River Rother at Eckington. Although there is little plantlife growing in the shallow runs there is a great diversity of invertebrates and fish. This is typical of a nutrient poor stream and warrants its status as a site of special interest. A whole series of dams were made to provide water power to run the bellows of furnaces and turn grinding wheels. These are now in various states of repair. Some are used by private fishing clubs from the nearby large centres of population, whilst in the hamlet of Birleyhay one forms part of a private garden.
